Frequently Asked Questions

What is the significance of family businesses in the U.S. economy?

Family businesses represent nearly 70% of all businesses and contribute about 60% of jobs in the United States. Their impact on GDP and local economies is substantial, particularly in sectors like retail, where they constitute nearly 80% of the market.

How do family businesses affect job creation?

What are the survival rates of family businesses?

What challenges do family businesses face?
